Title: H.P. Lovecraft's Cool Air
Cast: Morgan Weisser, Wendy Phillips, Crystal Green, Jenny Dare Paulin, Norbert Weisser
Plot: A struggling screenwriter suffers a heart attack and is saved by his mysterious upstairs neighbor, a doctor who introduces him to a nightmarish world of insane experiments.

Title: Phantasm
Cast: A. Michael Baldwin, Bill Thornbury, Reggie Bannister, Kathy Lester, Angus Scrimm
Plot: A teenage boy and his friends face off against a mysterious grave robber known as the Tall Man, who employs a lethal arsenal of unearthly weapons and dwarf minions.

Title: Rollerball
Cast: James Caan, John Houseman, Maud Adams, John Beck, Moses Gunn, Ralph Richardson
Plot: In a corporate-controlled future, an ultra-violent sport represents the world, and one of its powerful athletes defies those who want him out of the game.

Title: Shutter Island
Cast: Leonardo DiCaprio, Mark Ruffalo, Ben Kingsley, Max von Sydow, Michelle Williams, Emily Mortimer
Plot: A U.S. Marshal investigates the disappearance of a patient from a psychiatric facility on a remote island, but his efforts are compromised by troubling visions and a mysterious conspiracy.

Title: A Quiet Place
Cast: Emily Blunt, John Krasinski, Millicent Simmonds, Noah Jupe
Plot: In a post-apocalyptic world, a family must live in complete silence to avoid detection by alien creatures that hunt by sound. The family communicates through sign language and must take extreme precautions to survive while protecting their children, including a deaf daughter and a young son.

Title: Insidious
Cast: Patrick Wilson, Rose Byrne, Lin Shaye, Ty Simpkins, Barbara Hershey
Plot: A family looks to prevent evil spirits from trapping their comatose child in a realm called The Further. When their son inexplicably enters a comatose state and begins to attract malevolent entities, his parents seek help from a psychic to save him before he becomes lost forever.

Title: The Dark Tower
Cast: Idris Elba, Matthew McConaughey, Tom Taylor, Kathryn Winnick, Abbey Lee
Plot: A boy haunted by visions of a dark tower from a parallel reality teams up with the tower's disillusioned guardian to stop an evil warlock known as the Man in Black who plans to use the boy to destroy the tower and open the gates of Hell. Based on Stephen King's novel series, the film follows gunslinger Roland Deschain and young Jake Chambers as they battle to save the Dark Tower, a mystical structure that supports all realities.

Title: IT
Cast: Richard Thomas, Tim Curry, Annette O'Toole, Harry Anderson, Dennis Christopher
Plot: A group of outcast kids known as The Losers Club fight an evil demon who poses as a child-killing clown in 1960s Maine. Thirty years later, they reunite to stop the demon once and for all when it returns to their hometown.

Title: Midnite Movies Double Feature: The Land That Time Forgot/The People That Time Forgot
Cast: Doug McClure, John McEnery, Susan Penhaligon, Patrick Wayne, Sarah Douglas
Plot: Two Edgar Rice Burroughs adaptations featuring explorer Doug McClure discovering prehistoric worlds. In the first film, a WWI submarine crew discovers a lost island of dinosaurs; in the sequel, a rescue mission returns to the mysterious land of Caprona.

Title: My Neighbor Totoro
Cast: Dakota Fanning, Elle Fanning, Tim Daly, Lea Salonga, Frank Welker
Plot: When two girls move to the country to be near their ailing mother, they have adventures with the wondrous forest spirits who live nearby. The younger sister befriends a giant, gentle creature called Totoro who helps the children navigate their new life and cope with their mother's illness.

Title: The Chronicles of Riddick: Dark Fury
Cast: Vin Diesel, Rhiana Griffith, Keith David, Nick Chinlund, Roger L. Jackson
Plot: Bridging the gap between Pitch Black and The Chronicles of Riddick, this animated feature follows Riddick and his companions Jack and Imam as they're captured by a bounty hunter ship. They must face the sadistic Captain Chillingsworth who collects criminals as living art pieces. Riddick must use his skills to survive and escape this deadly collection.

Title: The Addams Family/Addams Family Values Double Feature
Cast: Anjelica Huston, Raul Julia, Christopher Lloyd, Christina Ricci, Joan Cusack
Plot: A double feature collection containing both Addams Family films. In the first film, a con artist claiming to be Uncle Fester infiltrates the macabre Addams household. In the sequel, the Addams children are sent to summer camp while a new nanny plots to marry and murder Uncle Fester for his fortune.

Title: The Maltese Falcon
Cast: Humphrey Bogart, Mary Astor, Peter Lorre, Sydney Greenstreet
Plot: A private detective takes on a case that involves him with three eccentric criminals, a gorgeous liar, and their quest for a priceless statuette. Sam Spade gets caught up in a dangerous web of crime and deception after his partner is murdered while investigating a case involving the mysterious black bird.

Title: Hollow Man
Cast: Kevin Bacon, Elisabeth Shue, Josh Brolin, Kim Dickens, Greg Grunberg
Plot: A brilliant scientist successfully turns himself invisible but the process slowly drives him insane and megalomaniacal. As his colleagues attempt to reverse the experiment, he becomes increasingly violent and turns against them. The team must fight for survival against an enemy they cannot see.

Title: I Know Who Killed Me
Cast: Lindsay Lohan, Julia Ormond, Neal McDonough, Brian Geraghty, Spencer Garrett
Plot: A young woman who was abducted and tortured claims to be a different person when she is found. She insists she is not the missing student Aubrey Fleming but rather a stripper named Dakota Moss, leading to a complex psychological mystery about identity and dark secrets.

Title: The Rocky Horror Picture Show
Cast: Tim Curry, Susan Sarandon, Barry Bostwick, Richard O'Brien, Patricia Quinn
Plot: A newly engaged couple's car breaks down in a storm, leading them to seek help at a nearby castle inhabited by the eccentric Dr. Frank-N-Furter and his peculiar servants. They become entangled in Frank-N-Furter's wild scheme to create the perfect man while experiencing a night of music, dance, and sexual liberation.

Title: Alone in the Dark
Cast: Christian Slater, Tara Reid, Stephen Dorff
Plot: A detective of the paranormal slowly unravels mysterious events with deadly results. As he investigates, he teams up with his ex-girlfriend to battle an ancient race of beings attempting to break through to our world.

Title: Hannibal Rising
Cast: Gaspard Ulliel, Gong Li, Dominic West, Rhys Ifans, Richard Brake
Plot: After witnessing the violent death of his parents and sister during World War II, young Hannibal Lecter escapes to his uncle's home in France. Years later, he seeks revenge against those responsible for his family's deaths, beginning his transformation into the infamous cannibalistic killer.

Title: Stay
Cast: Ewan McGregor, Naomi Watts, Ryan Gosling, Bob Hoskins, Janeane Garofalo
Plot: A psychiatrist attempts to prevent one of his patients from committing suicide while trying to maintain his own grip on reality. As he becomes more involved with the troubled young man, the boundaries between fantasy and reality begin to blur in unexpected ways.

Title: Charlie Bartlett
Cast: Anton Yelchin, Robert Downey Jr., Hope Davis, Kat Dennings, Tyler Hilton
Plot: A rich kid becomes the self-appointed psychiatrist to the student body of his new public high school. Charlie dispenses advice and prescription drugs to fellow students from a bathroom stall, becoming one of the most popular kids in school while attracting the attention of the principal and his daughter.

Title: My Son, My Son, What Have Ye Done
Cast: Michael Shannon, Willem Dafoe, Chloë Sevigny, Udo Kier, Grace Zabriskie
Plot: Inspired by a true crime, the film follows the investigation of a man who killed his mother with a sword after becoming obsessed with a Greek tragedy he was performing in. Detectives piece together the suspect's unraveling mental state through flashbacks and witness accounts.

Title: Mirrors
Cast: Kiefer Sutherland, Paula Patton, Cameron Boyce, Amy Smart
Plot: An ex-cop and his family are the target of an evil force that is using mirrors as a gateway into their home. After being suspended from the NYPD, Ben Carson takes a job as a night security guard at a burned-out department store, where he begins to see disturbing images in the mirrors.

Title: Fracture
Cast: Anthony Hopkins, Ryan Gosling, David Strathairn, Rosamund Pike, Embeth Davidtz
Plot: A wealthy engineer shoots his wife and engages in a battle of wits with a young assistant district attorney. Despite seeming like an open-and-shut case, the prosecutor discovers the defendant has manipulated the evidence, turning the trial into a complex psychological chess match.

Title: Ghost
Cast: Patrick Swayze, Demi Moore, Whoopi Goldberg, Tony Goldwyn
Plot: After a young man is murdered, his spirit stays behind to warn his lover of impending danger, with the help of a reluctant psychic. He must save her from the man who killed him while learning to harness his ghostly powers.

Title: The Nun
Cast: Demián Bichir, Taissa Farmiga, Jonas Bloquet, Bonnie Aarons, Ingrid Bisu
Plot: A priest with a haunted past and a novice on the threshold of her final vows are sent by the Vatican to investigate the death of a young nun in Romania and confront a malevolent force in the form of a demonic nun. As they uncover the abbey's unholy secret, they risk their lives, their faith, and their very souls.

Title: Constantine
Cast: Keanu Reeves, Rachel Weisz, Shia LaBeouf, Tilda Swinton, Pruitt Taylor Vince
Plot: Supernatural detective John Constantine helps a policewoman prove her sister's death was not a suicide, but something more. Constantine has the ability to see half-angels and half-demons in their true forms, walking the earth disguised as humans. As he investigates, he uncovers a plot involving the balance between Heaven and Hell.

Title: Resident Evil: Afterlife
Cast: Milla Jovovich, Ali Larter, Wentworth Miller, Shawn Roberts, Boris Kodjoe
Plot: While still out to destroy the evil Umbrella Corporation, Alice joins a group of survivors living in a prison surrounded by the infected who also want to relocate to the mysterious but supposedly unharmed safe haven known only as Arcadia. After freeing another group of survivors from a trap set by Umbrella, Alice continues her fight against the corporation and the undead.

Title: Resident Evil: Extinction
Cast: Milla Jovovich, Oded Fehr, Ali Larter, Iain Glen, Ashanti
Plot: Years after the Umbrella Corporation's T-virus has spread across the globe, turning most of humanity into zombies, Alice continues her fight against the corporation while helping a convoy of survivors reach Alaska. The convoy, led by Claire Redfield, struggles to find safety in a world overrun by the undead while Umbrella's Dr. Isaacs hunts Alice for her unique blood.

Title: The Last Man on Earth
Cast: Vincent Price, Franca Bettoia, Emma Danieli, Giacomo Rossi Stuart
Plot: Dr. Robert Morgan is the sole survivor of a plague that has transformed humanity into vampire-like creatures. By day he hunts and destroys the infected while they sleep, and by night he barricades himself in his home as they attempt to break in. His lonely existence is disrupted when he encounters a woman who may be infected but shows signs of immunity.
